cursor.description: The cursor pointer to fetch the data (value should be taken from previousCursor and nextCursor)
cursor.name: cursor

fields.description: Comma delimited fields that should be added to the resource by performing joins. For example, in order to get the IP address of a node when calling the nodes endpoints, setting 'ip4log.ip' into this field will provide the latest IP address of the device in the 'ip4log.ip' field of every node that is returned.
fields.name: fields

limit.description: The maximum amount of entries to get.
limit.name: limit

search_query.description: The JSON encoded search query following the Search schema defined in this spec
search_query.name: query

sort.description: A list of fields to sort on along with the ordering way (ASC or DESC).
sort.name: sort

BadRequest.description: Bad Request. One of the submitted parameters has an invalid format

Created.description: A response that contains the location of a created resource

Location.description: The location of the created resource

Duplicate.description: An attempt to add a duplicate entry was stopped. Entry already exists and should be modified instead of created.

ErrorsWithMessage.description: A response that contains a message along with explanatory error messages tied to fields

Forbidden.description: Forbidden access to the resource because of insufficient access rights

Message.description: A response that contains a simple message

NotFound.description: Request cannot be processed because the resource could not be found.

Unauthorized.description: Unauthorized access because of invalid credentials

UnprocessableEntity.description: Request cannot be processed because the resource has failed validation after the modification.

access_level.description: Comma delimited list of admin roles (as defined in adminroles.conf)

expiration.description: The date at which the account becomes invalid

password.description: The BCRYPT encrypted password of the user

tenant_id.description: The tenant ID this API user has access to. When set to 0, the API user has access to all tenants.

username.description: The username of the API user

valid_from.description: The date from which the account becomes valid

access_registration_when_registered.description: Whether or not the registration portal should be accessible when the device is already registered (like when renewing billing) values(enabled|disabled)

always_use_redirecturl.description: Whether or not the redirect url (redirecturl) should be forced when the user is released from the portal

autoregister.description: Whether or not the devices using this profile should be auto-registered values(enabled|disabled)

billing_tiers.description: Comma delimited list of billing tiers identifiers

block_interval.description: The amount of time a device is blocked after reaching the login_attempt_limit or the sms_pin_retry_limit

description.description: The user friendly description of the connection profile

device_registration.description: The device registration policy to apply on this connection profile

dot1x_recompute_role_from_portal.description: When enabled, PacketFence will not use the role initialy computed on the portal but will use the dot1x username to recompute the role. values(enabled|disabled)

filter.description: Comma delimited list of filters to apply for this profile.  For example, "ssid:Test-SSID,connection_type:Wireless-802.11-NoEAP"

id.description: The identifier of the connection profile

login_attempt_limit.description: The amount of invalid login attempts on the portal before the device is temporarily blacklisted from using the portal.

logo.description: The portal path to the logo for this profile. If the logo is in "html/captive-portal/content", then the path should start with "/content", if its in "html/common", then the path should start with "/common"

preregistration.description: Whether or not pre-registration should be enabled on this connection profile. values(enabled|disabled)

provisioners.description: Comma delimited list of provisioner identifiers to apply on this connection profile.

redirecturl.description: URL to redirect the user when he is being released from the captive-portal

reuse_dot1x_credentials.description: Whether or not the 802.1x credentials should be used as as an SSO login on the captive portal.

root_module.description: The root portal module identifier to use.

scans.description: Comma delimited list of scan identifiers to use on this profile.

sms_pin_retry_limit.description: The amount of times a user can retry an SMS PIN.

sms_request_limit.description: The amount of time a user can attempt to register via SMS. Use it to prevent users from spamming other people using the captive portal.

sources.description: Comma delimited list of authentication sources to use on this connection profile.

circuit_id_string.description: Encoded agent-local identifier from which a DHCP client-to-server packet was received

created_at.description: The date/time of when this record was created

host.description: The stripped MAC address of the switch

module.description: The number of the Cisco stacked switch

option82_switch.description: The IPv4 address of the switch

port.description: The numeric port number of the switch

switch_id.description: The unique identifier of the switch

end_time.description: The date/time the node was last seen.

ip.description: The ipv4 address of the node.

mac.description: The MAC address of the node.

start_time.description: The date/time the node was first seen.

tenant_id.description: The unique numeric identifier of the node tenant.

nextCursor.description: The cursor to access the data after the one returned in the response

previousCursor.description: The cursor to access the data before the one returned in the response

id.description: The unique numeric identifier of the locationlog

role.description: The role of the connection profile

session_id.description: The unique identifier of the session

ssid.description: The SSID of the client connection

stripped_user_name.description: The user name of the clients connection

tenant_id.description: The unique identifier of the clients tenant

message.description: A meaninful user readable message about what happened

autoreg.description: Whether or not the node was autoregistered (i.e. didn't go through the captive-portal) (yes|no)

bandwidth_balance.description: The amount of bandwidth the device has left on the network. This is used only for bandwidth balance access that relies on the accounting data.

bypass_role_id.description: The category ID (role ID) that acts as an override to the defined role in the `category_id` field.

bypass_vlan.description: The VLAN to apply on the device to override the one that would be defined in the switch configuration for this role.

category_id.desription: The category ID (role ID) of the node

detect_date.description: The date at which the node was discovered by PacketFence

device_class.description: The class of the device as detected by Fingerbank.

device_score.description: The confidence level (0 to 100) that Fingerbank has on the profiling it did for this node.

device_type.description: The name of the device as detected by Fingerbank.

device_version.description: The OS version of the device as detected by Fingerbank.

dhcp6_enterprise.description: The DHCPv6 enterprise ID as seen by Fingerbank (used for device profiling).

dhcp6_fingerprint.description: The DHCPv6 Fingerprint as seen by Fingerbank (used for device profiling).

dhcp_fingerprint.description: The DHCP Fingerprint as seen by Fingerbank (used for device profiling).

dhcp_vendor.description: The DHCP vendor as seen by Fingerbank (used for device profiling).

last_arp.description: The last time PacketFence saw an ARP request for this node.

last_dhcp.description: The last time PacketFence saw a DHCP request for this node.

last_seen.description: The last time PacketFence saw this node.

mac.description: The MAC address of the device

machine_account.description: The machine username of this node if it ever did machine authentication (only works for Windows hosts or usernames that start with `host/`)

pid.description: The person ID (owner) of the node

regdate.description: The date at which the node was registered. Will be `0000-00-00 00:00:00` when the node is unregistered.

sessionid.description: The session ID of the device (used for certain switches)

status.description: The status of the device (reg, unreg, pending)

tenant_id.description: The tenant ID of the node

time_balance.description: The amount of time the device has left on the network before being unregistered. This is used only for time balance access that relies on the accounting data.

unregdate.description: The date at which the node will be deregistered (switch back to unreg). Will be `0000-00-00 00:00:00` when the node is unregistered.

user_agent.description: The HTTP user agent of the device as seen by Fingerbank.

voip.description: Whether or not the node is a VoIP device for PacketFence (yes|no)

access_duration.description: The access duration that should be given to a node when this account is used is used to register a device

access_level.description: The administrative access level that should be given to the user when he logs into the administration interface

category.description: The role that should be given to a node when this account is used to register a device

expiration.description: The date at which the password expires (becomes invalid)

login_remaining.description: The amount of logins that the user has remaining. When null, the user has unlimited logins

password.description: The password of the local account. When encrypted, it is prefixed by the encryption type surrounded by brackets. For example "{ntlm}iosnuiofsauionsfdioun"

pid.description: The username of the local account

sponsor.description: Whether or not this account can be used to sponsor other users via a SponsorEmail source

unregdate.description: The unregistration date that should be given to a node when this account is used to register a device

valid_from.description: The date at which the password becomes valid

field.description: The field to perform the search on. It is possible to specify fields from other API endpoints (ex: ip4log.ip)

op.description: The operator to use against the value of the field. Can be `and`, `or`, `is`, `is_not`, `match`, `not_match`, `contains`, `not_contains`, `between` and `not_between`

value.description: The search term to use when performing the search using on the specified field. This field must be used when the operator performs the condition against a single string value.

values.description: An array of simple/complex searches to use with the provided operator. To be used when the operator expects complex values as arguments. Refer to the examples for how to use this efficiently. This field must follow the same structure as this schema.

alive.description: Whether the service is alive or not.

enabled.description: Whether the service is enabled or not.

managed.description: Whether the service is managed or not.

start.description: Whether the service was disabled or not.
Whether the service was enabled or not.

restart.description: Whether the service was restarted or not.

start.description: Whether the service was started or not.

stop.description: Whether the service was stopped or not.

domain_name.description: The domain name of this tenant as used in 802.1x connections for the realm. For example, in the username tommy@example.com, example.com is the domain name.

id.description: The unique numeric identifier of the tenant

name.description: The user friendly name of the tenant

portal_domain_name.description: The portal domain name for this tenant. Any request on the portal using this domain name will be scoped to this tenant.

firstname.description: The first name of the user.

lastname.description: The last name of the user.

nodes_url.description: link to the nodes of this user

password_url.description: link to the password (local account) of this user. If there is none, the value will be empty.

description.description: The name of the violation class.

release_date.description: The date/time when the violation was closed.

start_date.description: The date/time when the violation was opened.

computername.description: The computer name of the node that triggered the violation.

mac.description: The MAC address of the node that triggered the violation.

notes.description: Additional note from the violation class.

release_date.description: The date/time when the violation was closed.

start_date.description: The date/time when the violation was opened.

ticket_ref.description: The ticket reference of the violation.

info.description: An API to access the PacketFence resources. Lets make the PacketFence API great again!
info.title: PacketFence API
